title: Usability Evaluation of LLMs in Legal Document Drafting
description: This study investigates the usability of LLMs in drafting legal documents, focusing on their ability to maintain legal accuracy, coherence, and adherence to legal standards.
motivation: Legal document drafting requires precision and adherence to specific legal standards, which LLMs currently struggle to achieve consistently. This research aims to develop a usability evaluation framework to assess and improve the performance of LLMs in this domain.
questions: How do Large Language Models (LLMs) compare to traditional legal drafting processes in terms of accuracy, coherence, and adherence to legal standards when creating legal documents?
What are the specific challenges and limitations faced by legal professionals when utilizing LLMs for drafting legal documents, and how do these affect the final output's usability?
In what ways can the integration of LLMs into legal document drafting processes improve efficiency and productivity while ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations?
